Exception to Benefit Waiver Rule:  Withdrawal of Application for Social Security
Under
38 CFR 3.271(i)
, a person may not waive entitlement to potential benefits from non-VA sources to receive or increase VA current-law pension.  Potential income from such waived sources counts as income for current-law pension.
However, if a claimant or beneficiary withdraws a Social Security application after a finding of entitlement so as to maintain eligibility for an unreduced Social Security benefit on attainment of age 65, do
not
regard the withdrawal as a waiver per
38 CFR 3.271(i)
.
Note
:  Do not count as income the Social Security benefit that would have been received except for the withdrawal of the application.
